text: I remember a while ago talking to a couple of people about initialising parameters in Turing, has that been properly implemented yet? It is mentioned in the docs but cannot see a way to actually do it looking at the codebase

elements.text: I remember a while ago talking to a couple of people about initialising parameters in Turing, has that been properly implemented yet? It is mentioned in the docs but cannot see a way to actually do it looking at the codebase

text: No, not in a good way. If you're using and of the HMC samplers you can pass `sample(. . .; init_params = something)`.

elements.text: No, not in a good way. If you're using and of the HMC samplers you can pass
sample(. . .; init_params = something)

text: Where `something` is a vector of parameters in the order that they appear in your model.

elements.text: Where
something
is a vector of parameters in the order that they appear in your model.
